If you are a Jr. PHP Developer with experience, please read on! Located in Tampa, Fl. we are the software division of the Fest Corporation Family of Companies which include American Marketing and Mailing and American Visual Brands.
 Top Reasons to Work with Us
 You get to work with other top talent Developers who value the same principles as you do. We encourage learning new techniques, sharing your knowledge with others and invest in the training to get you to the next level. We’re an equal opportunity employer providing a fun but respectful environment to work in. We strive to make your role both challenging and rewarding.
 What You Will Be Doing
 The role is for a Senior Developer to help lead the Web Team into the next generation of web content delivery. We’re looking for someone with experience with multiple frameworks and languages who can quickly learn and understand our code base, help identify architecture and performance improvements, and can drive a transition plan to get there while continuing to improve our user experience.
 What You Need for this Position
 Experience: 1+ yrs PHP software development With the following languages/frameworks: PHP/ Symfony, Javascript, CSS, HTML
 What’s In It for You
 For your hard work we are offering a competitive salary benefits and vacation! Dress is Jeans casual with periodic employee team building activities. So, if you are a Jr. PHP Developer with experience, please apply today!
 Applicants must be local applicants authorized to work in the U.S.

Job Description 


Salary Range: $64,480 - $90,000 
The Digital Precision String Suite (DPSS) team is seeking an enthusiastic and motivated Junior Software Engineer to provide software development services at NAWCWD China Lake. The DPSS team develops and delivers innovative and custom software solutions/products that enable the ability to securely execute mission requirements. 
The incumbent will perform software engineering over the product life cycle in an agile Scrum environment, encompassing requirements development, requirements analysis, design, coding, unit testing, system integration, and documentation. 


Essential Job Functions:
 Work closely with other software developers, test team members, systems engineers, technical writers and end users to produce a high quality product. 
Developing and modifying system applications and software, fixing errors, adapting code to new design standards and hardware, improving performance, upgrading interfaces, and conducting development tests. 
Participate in the peer review process. 
Working with senior engineers and project leads on technical issues regarding software system design, maintenance, and security. 
Attend and contribute to various development meetings. 
Work in a security sensitive and process oriented environment. 


Required Skills:
 Due to the sensitivity of customer related requirements, U.S. Citizenship is required. 
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or BS in STEM 
Must be able to obtain a Secret level security clearance and maintain for the duration of employment. 
Understanding of Object Oriented Design (OOD) and Object Oriented Programming (OOP). 
Knowledge in any of the following programming languages, C++, Java, and C# . 
Knowledge of databases and operating systems. 
Knowledge of the scrum framework, techniques, and artifacts. 
Knowledge and understanding of agile software development life cycle. 
Experience with Software Version Control. 
Ability to learn new software and technologies quickly. 
Self-motivated, detail-oriented and adaptable. 
Ability to work independently as well as within a team. 
Ability to speak/write clearly and professionally. 


Desired Skills:
 Previous experience in the government/DoD software development. 

 Experience or understanding of Agile Scrum methodologies. 
Experience with avionics systems and components. 
Experience with Git Version Control System. 
Knowledge of Jira or similar tool set.

Amentum is actively seeking a Junior Web / SharePoint Developer to provide development and maintenance of multiple SharePoint sites. The position will be located at Fort Meade, MD supporting the Air Force Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance platforms.
We are pipelining candidates for a future role.
You are highly skilled in Web development and/or developing components within SharePoint, and have a desire to design custom content for SharePoint sites. You are imaginative, resourceful, and interested in using your skills in Web development and design to support our mission. You’re also self-reliant and enjoy learning on the job from others, and can be flexible in the design elements you choose to suit multiple generations of workers.
Responsibilities:

Design, configure, implement, and deploy SharePoint custom solutions to support business processes using SharePoint 2013 out-of-the-box capabilities and SharePoint Designer 2013.
Design and develop custom content types to support, enhance, and facilitate business processes and related data.
Design and develop custom dashboards using out-of-the-box capabilities and SharePoint Designer.
Design and develop custom calculations to enhance business and process related metrics.
Design and develop custom workflows using out-of-the-box capabilities and SharePoint Designer to enhance, support, and facilitate business process related data.
Develop custom Data View Web Parts using SharePoint Designer and provide support for deployed custom SharePoint solutions and workflows in both SharePoint 2013 and SharePoint 2010.
Understand and manipulate basic JavaScript and CSS to enhance SharePoint functionality when out-of-the-box solutions are not available.
Design and develop unique SharePoint pages and master pages to customize the look and feel of the site collections.

Here at Amentum, we are purpose-driven with a fierce commitment to deliver on our promises. We create trailblazing solutions, have unwavering integrity, and embrace inclusion and collaboration. Our team is excited to help customers solve today’s and tomorrow’s problems, giving confidence and reassurance that together we’ll accomplish mission success.
Minimum Requirements:

Associates Degree, and at least 4 years of overall work experience, with 2 years of experience required in Web / SharePoint development
Or a High school diploma/GED, and at least 8 years of overall work experience, with 6 years of experience required in Web / SharePoint development
At least 2 years of experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and/or similar languages, and a willingness to work with this tech stack
Familiarity with Bootstrap 3.3.6+ and Jquery 3.6+
Must have an active TS/SCI security clearance with the ability to obtain a polygraph. Poly must be granted in order to start.

Preferred Qualifications:

Familiarity with SharePoint 2016, WordPress, and SiteWorks
At least 2 years of experience with designing and implementing custom business solutions using SharePoint 2013, Out-of-the-Box capabilities, configuring SharePoint sites, sub-sites, and user permissions, and managing SharePoint collections
Experience with supporting an enterprise-wide instantiation of SharePoint 2013
Experience with implementing permissions in SharePoint in a site collection and with business solution designs

Description: 
  About Us
 Plateau GRP is a growing company that values your skills, training, and ideas. At Plateau, you are our greatest asset. We provide a path to keep growing your career. We strive to foster an environment that's welcoming, diverse, respectful, and inclusive. Plateau offers competitive salaries and employee benefits. Salary will be dependent on experience and will reflect education, work experience, and demonstrated skills.
 Plateau Grp is currently hiring Junior Application .Net developers for their Fairfax, VA and Daleville, AL. locations. As a hybrid model, candidates are expected to be onsite at these locations 2-3 days a week to learn and collaborate with the team.
 As an Junior Application Developer, you will be part of the development and maintenance team with a focus on .NET and web-based software solutions. This role is in a high performing team with growth opportunities.
 Requirements
 Duties and Responsibilities:

 Coding according to business requirements following industry best practices
 Team player with a proactive attitude, the ability to be productive in a dynamic / collaborative environment
 Produce software documentation and engage in quality assurance activities.
 Maintain established configuration management process.
 Collaborate daily with team members and program leadership.
 Proactively learning about new technologies.
 Requirements: 
 
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related discipline
 Nice to have 1-2 years of relevant experience. Fresh graduates with some academic experience will also be considered.
 Has strong oral and written communication skills and samples of personal project's.
 Understanding and familiarity with any of the following programming languages: C#, C++, Java, Python and SQL.
 Knowledge/experience with industry practices and design patterns.
 Ability to work independently on simple and advanced work assignments.
 Ability to interact with cross-functional teams.

 Plateau does not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters without a signed third-party agreement. Any unsolicited third-party resumes forwarded by recruiters to Plateau or to any of our managers or employees will be considered public information, may be treated as a direct application from the person identified in the resume, and will not be eligible for placement fee payment to the agency.
 EOE Statement:
 Plateau is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer; all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, gender, gender identification, sex, sexual orientation, color, race, creed, national origin, religion, marital status, parental status, citizenship status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, military status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local laws.
 Plateau is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities. If you require reasonable accommodation, please email the Plateau HR Department at hrteam@plateauinc.com
 Plateau is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer! (M/F/Disability/Vets)

Develop efficient and user-friendly software interfaces based on user needs.

TITLE
 Jr. Cloud Engineer

 LOCATION
 Hybrid- Raleigh, NC

 YOUR ROLE 
We are looking for a Jr. Cloud Engineer who will collaborate with other software and cloud engineers and business teams to support our technology strategy and architecture around how we manage our public cloud environment and deliver innovative technology solutions for Enact Mortgage Insurance. You should have experience with traditional and modern technologies and platforms such as AWS, Java, NoSQL databases, Python, REST API, relational databases, Git, JavaScript, Shell scripting, Docker, Jenkins, Terraform, etc. In this role, you will be responsible for managing the operational aspects of our public cloud environment, managing terraform, working with development teams, creating new support tools, and improving existing products with new technologies & solutions, play a hands-on development and design role in a rapid and dynamic environment.

 Who you are:

 You yearn to be part of cutting-edge technology, delivering value to the business through high profile projects.
 Someone who is not intimidated by challenges; thrives even under pressure; is passionate about their craft; and hyper focused on delivering exceptional results
 Passionate about new technology, as well as new/emerging concepts and techniques
 Someone who is excited to learn a new business
 You’re passionate about engineering, automation, performance, and CI/CD
 You like to work with modern architecture and latest open-source technologies: Microservices, Docker, Terraform, AWS, Node.js, Java, Python, and many more
 You take an interest in infrastructure resiliency and how your code works at runtime: OS, network, and AWS cloud
 You participate in forums, hackathons, meetups, and conferences
 You own your work by building systems to succeed in production, and you fix them when they don’t


 YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

 Primarily build modern pipelines (CI/CD) to automate, enhance and support immutable environment for applications in the public cloud (AWS)
 Additionally assist in building data platform infrastructure (Snowflake, Talend) and pipelines to support reporting and data science needs within the business
 Work with auditor and security personnel on governance capabilities for the company's cloud environment
 Part of a dedicated team to create and enhance software that enables state of the art, next generation modern applications
 Support practices like Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, Test Automation, Build Automation and Test-Driven Development to enable the rapid delivery of working code utilizing tools like Jenkins, Nexus, Terraform, Git and Docker


 YOUR QUALIFICATIONS

 Bachelor’s Degree
 At least 2 years’ experience in software development and programming in Java, or Python
 At least 2 years of experience developing automated infrastructure build scripts within Cloud computing environment (AWS)
 2+ years of experience with open-source technologies
 2+ years of experience with Containerized environments like Docker, Kubernetes, ECS, Fargate etc.
 Experience taking technical ownership over projects
 Working knowledge of operating systems, networking, storage and other infrastructure technologies and concepts


 PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

 5+ years of experience in developing large, distributed platforms
 3+ years of Agile engineering experience
 3+ years of UNIX/Linux experience
 Experience working with Machine Learning and Data Science teams


 WHY WORK AT ENACT

 We have a real impact on the lives of the people we serve
 We work on challenging and rewarding projects
 We give back to the communities where we live
 We offer competitive benefits including:
   
 Medical, Dental, Vision, Flexible Spending Account options beginning your first day
 Generous Choice Time Off policy
 12 Paid Holidays
 40 hours of volunteer time off
 401K Account with matching contributions
 Tuition Reimbursement and Student Loan Repayment
 Paid Family Leave
 Child Care Subsidy Program



 COMPANY
 Enact, operating principally through its wholly-owned subsidiary Genworth Mortgage Insurance Corp. since 1981, is a leading U.S. private mortgage insurance provider committed to helping more people achieve the dream of homeownership. Building on a deep understanding of lenders’ businesses and a legacy of financial strength, we partner with lenders to bring best-in class service, leading underwriting expertise, and extensive risk and capital management to the mortgage process, helping to put more people in homes and keep them there. By empowering customers and their borrowers, Enact seeks to positively impact the lives of those in the communities in which it serves in a sustainable way. Enact is headquartered in Raleigh, North Carolina.

 Through our values of Excellence, Improvement and Connection, the Enact team delivers on our mission to help more people realize the dream of homeownership. The positive impact we can have on our world inspires us to go the extra mile. We look at the bigger picture, always considering our customers’ processes and their borrowers’ experience. We work hard to anticipate all the effects our actions might have. That can make our work challenging, and also satisfying.

 Are you the kind of person who’s always anticipating your customers’ needs? Always one step ahead, ready to catch that unexpected curveball? If so, you could thrive with us.

 We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and all hiring decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and business need. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

We are looking to hire an Angular Front-end Developer to join our dynamic team. As a developer, you will be responsible for creating a top-level coding-base using software best practices. Your role will require you to implement an exciting and streamlined user experience in the form of a web application. To ensure success as a Developer, you should have extensive knowledge of theoretical software engineering, be proficient in web app development, Typescript, HTML, and CSS.
Your experience

2+ years of experience with designing and developing user interfaces using Angular best practices.
Adapting interface for modern internet applications using the latest front-end technologies.
Writing JavaScript, TypeScript, CSS, and HTML.
Developing product analysis tasks.
Making complex technical and design decisions for Angular projects.
Developing application codes and unit tests in Angular and Rest Web Services.
Conducting performance tests.
Consulting with the design team.
Ensuring high performance of applications and providing support.
Willing to travel

Knowledge and skills needed
You need to have the knowledge and skills required for working with various programming languages/techniques:
- Angular 9 and higher
- Javascript, Typescript
- jQuery, Ajax
- HTML/CSS
- API integrations

We offer:
- A competitive salary with benefits
- Pleasant work environment
- Flexible work time
- Working on an international market

Job Title
  Jr. Developer
 

   Job Description
 

   Cooper Lighting Solutions builds forward-thinking lighting solutions that make people’s lives safer, while making buildings, homes and cities smarter and more sustainable. We deliver an industry-leading portfolio of indoor and outdoor lighting, lighting controls and smart lighting systems.
 


   Cooper Lighting Solutions is a business unit of Signify, the world leader in lighting. Together we have a shared purpose to unlock the extraordinary potential of light for brighter lives and a better world. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry.
 


   We’re looking for a Developer to join our team in our Midtown Atlanta office. You’ll be responsible for design and implementation of components for our world-class wired and wireless lighting control solutions for Office, Industry, Healthcare and Education customers.
 


   We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch!
 


   What you’ll do
 

   You will be part of an engaged and agile SW development team that delivers end-to-end features for our state-of-the-art networked lighting control solutions.
 

   Depending on your experience and interest, you will be working on technologies as diverse as Zigbee, BLE Mesh, Embedded FW, Linux Applications, Java Server/Cloud Applications, Angular Web Applications and/or Native Mobile Applications
 


   What you’ll need
 



     Bachelor’s or Master’s in Electrical & Computer Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent technical discipline from an accredited institution.
   


     Knowledgeable about Software Design Principles, showcasing a group OR individual project. Walk through design, developing, debugging on these project(s).
   


     Understanding of one of the programming languages such as C/C++ OR Java OR Mobile OS (Obj-C/Swift/Android Java).
   


     Motivated and self-driven to work in an cross-functional global team.
   


     Experience on mobile app development using Obj-C/Swift/Android Java.
   



   What you’ll get in return…
 

   We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.
 


   See 
  
   #SignifyLife
   through the eyes of our employees!
 


   Who we are
 

   Signify is the world leader in lighting. We provide professional customers and consumers with quality, energy-efficient LED lighting. And our lights, when connected, bring data to devices, apps and people – redefining what light can do and how you use it. Today, our innovations, such as LiFi – internet connectivity through light – and UV-C, solar and horticultural lighting, contribute to a safer, smarter, more sustainable world.
 

   We’re operating in 74 countries with 32,000 people worldwide.
 


   #LI-WC1

Brake Supply Company is an Equal Empl oyment Opportunity Employer and as such will recruit, hire, train, and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, genetics, physical or mental disability, or other protected characteristic. 

 Brake Supply Heavy Equipment Company, the world's leader in re-manufactured parts and components, is now hiring! Come join our growing team! 

 We are celebrating 75 years of business in 2022 (1947-2022)! Since 1947 Brake Supply has served the mining, marine, industrial and heavy equipment industry. Our 10 locations are dedicated to providing outstanding quality and customer service. Brake Supply is more than just brakes! We re-manufacture transmissions, torque converters, differentials, drivelines, final drives, wet brakes, hydraulic cylinders, pumps, motors, valves and much more. 

 Our headquarters located in Evansville, Indiana, has an immediate opening for a Junior Software Developer. This position will be located in-house in our Evansville, Indiana location. Some relocation assistance may be provided to the right candidate willing to relocate. 


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


Provide support for existing systems.
Support existing internal applications that have been developed by others using a combination of PHP, C#, ASP.Net MVC Framewrok, JSON, Unidata, MySQL.
Interact with office and shop personnel to determine needs when modifying or developing new applications.
Support system users via helpdesk tickets.
 Support applications on both Windows and Linux platforms. 



Performs more duties as assigned
 Additionally, the candidate will be expected to work as part of a team environment, have great communication skills, ability to learn and maintain Brake Supply legacy software, and be able to prioritize assigned jobs / projects on his or her own. 


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITES REQUIRED:


Software Design & Development preferred but not required
Web Design & Development (Using C#/MVC, PHP, and some HTML) preferred but not required
Troubleshooting & Analysis preferred
Project Teamwork & Communication
Windows and Linux Based Server OS (Ubuntu/Debian/RHEL/FC/etc) preferred
Apprentice/ Junior developer- all experience levels encouraged to apply.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITES PREFERRED, BUT NOT REQUIRED:


CSS
JavaScript
